intro: Acer monspessulanum subsp. athoum, commonly known as the Spanish maple, is a deciduous tree native to southern Europe and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, featuring a rounded canopy and smooth, grey bark. The leaves are palmately lobed, with a serrated margin and a bright green upper surface. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by red or orange samaras. This species prefers well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats.
